text: LCI. Uit de fles geschonken. Mooie San Diego Pale Ale, fijne bitterheid, flink wat hop en een mooie fruitsmaak. Prima bier op een warme avond in de woestijn
Slightly hazy gold pour with a thin white head. Orange, pine, caramel aromas. Taste is good malty backbone, orange, grapefruit, pine, with a fair amount of bitterness

Can.Just hazy amber with a white head that lasts OK and laces well. Aroma of sweet oranges, pine, bread, some herbs and herb. Light creamy texture with soft carbonation. 3+ Quite sweet with citrus, pine and bubblegum-like tropical fruit. Bitterness is modest with some mildly chivish herbal notes. Would have liked it to dry out a bit more at the ed, but perhaps that would have made it a bit harsh. Fine but both the X and the IPA are much more my sort of thing.

Crisp copper coloured body with a lighter orange and peach coloured tint, all with a thinnish, two centimetre tall off-white head. Aroma of citrus, light pine, a bit of floral notes and a smooth malt kick throughout, this one is nice and robust. Light to Medium-bodied; Assertive floral and grassy hop kick at first with a very smooth and subtle malt backbone showing some smooth yeast flavours as well and a hint of bread. Aftertaste is nice and mellow with only some of the hops coming out, but not a pressing bite nor any real pungency, just a nice balance and good flavour. Overall, a nice APA with a good profile, nice complexity, yet still smooth and easy-to-drink. Great to try, especially fresh and immediately after buying! I sampled this twelve ounce can purchase from New Beer Distributors in New York, New York a few minutes ago on 10-June-2017 for US$2,75 sampled while walking with my daughters in Greenwich Village and on the Subway in New York, New York on 10-June-2017.

Can from T&P. Hazy orange color. White head. Light hoppy nose. Some citrus. Low other fruit notes. Light grain. Flavor is light citrus, grassy, dry grain, lingering finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden, amber hue. White head, thin lacing and subtle retention. Floral, grapefruit, citrus, and mild candy notes. Medium bodied, citrus, grapefruit, and mild lemon notes. High hop bitterness, hot-sharpness, and slight dryness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pencil shavings, subtle honey nose. Clear amber, medium head, nice lace. Malty honey and caramel, tea and grass on the edges. Medium body, easy carbonation. Surprisingly malty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From can in tapered shaker. Pours amber with dense white head and aroma of madarin and pine. Nice malt backbone delivers some caramel into a modest bitter finish. Tasty
Can - pours gold with a big white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine and cereal malt. Taste is bit of caramel and pine up.front with a drying piney finish.

010617. Can from Greenslopes Cellars. This has all the qualities of a good American Pale Ale. Pours a clear honey amber with a sudsy white head. Aromas of malt are sweetish with a trace of citrus hops thrown in for good measure. Medium to full bodied in the mouth with a clean fresh finish.

12oz can picked up at Total Wine in LV 
Pours cloudy golden with a medium sized off-white head, light lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, grassy, fruity. Flavor of grapefruit, grassy, mild bisquity and citrus zest 
Good

On tap in San Diego. Pours rose gold with an orang-tinged head. Scent is citrus and hops. Taste is a balanced malt backbone with a hoppy kick that isn't overstated. Body is on the light side. Crisp semi-bitter finish that doesn't linger overlong. A very solid mild IPA.

Pours yellow orange, decent head that stays for some time. Aroma is fulfillingly hoppy, nice satisfying round herbal hops. That is balanced with biscuity malt character that leads a way to a beer that is with great drinkability. Goes down quickly, yet has body and character, also nice tingling bitterness. Ultimate session beer (at 6% if to look closely).

[Can (12oz)] Pours a clear deep golden-orange with a large long-lasting frothy off-white head. Minimal lacing. Nice aroma with lots of fruity hops, resiny hops and backed by slightly sweet bready malt. (7+) Flavour is also nice and hoppy, fruity and bready, along with moderate bitter finish. Medium bodied. I enjoyed this Pale Ale a lot, quite a pleasant version.

@ Budapest, Hungary üëåüèªüëåüèªüëå

w - Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary üç∫üç∫üç∫

Untappd: https://untappd.com/user/SeniorZozo /////// Facebook: www.facebook.com/beeroda/

Appearance: lighter copper golden. Hazy. Thin layer of white foam. 
Nose: decent amount of pine hops with elements of dank and mango as well. A touch sweet
Taste: Hop forward pine trending toward resin and a bit of earthy funk. Tropical fruitiness with a bit of candy sweetness. 
Body: Medium body with good active carbonation
Parting thoughts: Quite a good IPA with a lot of elements interacting well.

Can from Sake no Taniguchi. Pours orange-bronze with sticky lacing and tiny suspended particles. Big fresh citrus aroma, orange, tangerine, pine, mango. Flavour a touch less exciting, but still good orange and pine. Good moderate bitterness to balance the fruity sweetness, with a biscuity second half. Effervescent feel, easy to down. A winner.

Thanks to wombat23. Pours deep gold from the can and leaves a thick, frothy white head that subsides amidst moderate lacing. Aroma is a boquet of tropical fruits and pine. An appetizing beginning. Taste is up front bittersweet, with a mix of hops bitterness, and an underlying sweetness best described as a blend of honey melon and caramel. The finish turns quite bitter as the hops really come through and dominate. Body is medium, carbonation adequate, and there is even a touch of warmth at the end. Good fun for hops heads. Fun sipping. Given that I¬ím not a hops head, my half can was probably enough for one night though.
Lightly bitter, bread and toasty malt, fine balance of fruit and spruce, with a nice quenching finish. A pretty solid APA.

From the 12 fl. oz. can dated 02/14/17. The color is a nice looking orange-amber with a lasting white head. The aroma has a definite toffee and caramel malt sensation with a low hop profile. The body is around medium and smooth. The taste begins malty and slightly sweet but then a bitter bite kicks in at the end.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2017 Draft at Khyber Pass. Translucent deep orange amber pour that started with a large white head that left thick lace. Dank tropical citrus hops artfully balanced with medium caramel bready malts. Tangerine. Lime. Cherry. Mango. Peach. Plum. Pineapple. Artichoke. Spruce. Oak. Dandelion. Nice palate. Substantial but easy drinking.

Bottle. Clear golden orange beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus, grapefruit, stone fruit and lime. Flavor is fruity with notes of citrus, grapefruit, peaches, lime and grass. Well balanced.

Where and how:  can @ home 
Aroma splendid aroma, fresh mango, resin, sweet sugary malts, accacia honey and meadow flowers.
 Appearance :
Top: mid plus sized, off white with solid lace with rings
Base: fine haze on amber
Palate :  full bodied, soft texture, lighter carbonation, very smooth. longer finish.
Taste: in short refined smooth pale ale. Drinkable, refreshing, balanced and easy going as hell.
 Other notes  world class creation.
Aroma is citrus/orange, fruit and slight sugar/candy. The flavor is orange/citrus, malts, fruit, tropical fruit and a spicy/medium bitter hoppy finish.
Draught at Alesmith. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, resin, mango, grass and a bit of pine. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, resin, mango and grass. Very nice APA.

From a tap to a pint glass. Medium gold with a good amount of head. Smelled of dusty citrus hops. A decent drinking, non spectacular APA - medium body palate with a mild burntness and grapefruit hoppiness.

Can from Whole Foods. Pours hazy straw with off-white head and high carbonation level. Nose is floral hops, pale malt, citrus. Tastes hoppy, resiny, floral, with a smooth and complex mouthfeel and bitter finish that floats like a velvety cloud down the back of your eager throat.
on tap pour is hazy orange with white head citrus pine and sugar taste aroma is mostly citrus.

Pours a clear golden color with a persistent white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and sweet biscuity malt. Flavors were loaded with citrusy pine hoppiness and a sweet biscuit note. Low bitterness. Medium body, dry finish. Classic heavily hopped SD Pale Ale. Awesome!

Pours a cloudy amber with a white head and good lacing. 
Smell is of hops and grapefruit. 
Taste is hoppy, some pine, caramel, and grapefruit.

It¬ís beers like this that made Alesmith my most sought after brewery when I first started drinking craft beer. Awesome aroma. This thing was bursting of hop smells. Fresh grassy hops with heavy grapefruit and pine. Pour was a nice hazy dark orange with a one finger off white head. Taste was fantastic. Strong hoppy flavor that most straight IPAs would be envious of. Strong grapefruit and pine flavors with just enough balancing sweet malt to stop it from crossing into IPA territory. Nice carbonation. I can¬ít say enough about this awesome beer, so I¬íll shut up and have another
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Can pour into shaker pint glass from Greg & Jane¬ís Beer and Wine. Appearance is clear golden orange with trace sparkle, finger width foamy white head with fair retention and some sudsy lacing. Aroma is strong pine, tropical fruit, resin, grapefruit. Taste is tropical fruit balanced with dank resin, late pine and grapefruit, with cracker malt undercurrent. Palate is light bodied with slick texture, soft-to-average carbonation and nice bittersweet finish. Overall, almost as good as Tony Gwynn! Nice complexity and strong aroma and flavor.

Can. Gold, copper color and minimal head yet fairly high carbonation. Aroma is faint. Piney and grapefruity. Light bodied. Dry maltiness though there is some caramal flavors on the finish. Light kiss of citrus and pine. Easy drinking. Just as described: hoppy pale ale but not quite in the IPA realm.

Canned version. A clear light deep golden color. Frothy off-white head. Fruity-spice aromas. Body on the lighter side with plenty of flavor. Light sweet malts, spice, pine, citrus and fruit. Clean dry finish. Well made.

Can from Brewtopia. Bright clear copper with dense lasting head. Subtle pine citrus and minty aroma. Classic toasty fruity nutty medium sweetness with medium citrus rind bitterness. Medium light body. Medium carbo. Pretty much what you¬íd expect from an excellent American pale ale.
Can: Pencil shavings, subtle honey nose. Clear amber, medium head, nice lace. Malty honey and caramel, tea and grass on the edges. Medium body, easy carbonation. Surprisingly malty.

Poured into a becher pint glass, the appearance was a glossy copper color with a two finger white foamy head that glistened and fell at a nice pace. Messy foamy lace clung nicely.
The aroma reflected a nice blend of clean sweet malts, subtle crisp sweet and bitter pine. Lemon to citrusy pulpy sweetness.
The flavor took all of the previously mentioned aromas to blend nicely and lead into a sweet aftertaste with some subtle bitter piney/citrus notes. Semi-sticky sort of malty finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a great mobility along my tongue. Carbonation felt fine and the ABV felt good as projected by the brewer.
Overall, nicely done west coast styled APA, well worthy of having again.
Can from beer junction. Clear taste of corn with beady Malts. Fairly dank hops as well. Not bad but could have a bit more malt backbone.

Can. Pours a clear light orange with a thick white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grassy hops, floral hops, hop oils. Flavor of bitter grassy hops, pale malts, tropical fruits, pine cone. Very hoppy, decent bitterness, solid beer.
7/4/8/4/15 (3.8/5)

Hazy sunshine color with a thin head of whispy white foam. Dank and skunk citrus riddled out upon a dialed in malt formula. Smooth citrus with minimal bite. A balanced amount of dry pine in the finish.

Case of cans from Frank Smith¬ís. Pours golden caramel color with some foam that leaves minimal lace. Aroma is bergamot, breads notes, biscuits, and mild grassy notes. Taste is similar with pale malt, and cereal. Finish is lasting mild lime. Nice beer.

From the source - Probably one of the best APA¬ís out there. Pours a rich gold with a wishpy white head. Aroma is heavy in florals, funk and citrus. Subdued initially on the tongue but it snaps back nicely with some citrus, resin, hay and florals. Very drinkable.

On draft in Encinitas. Strong citrus and pine notes, heavy palate but not that flavourful or interesting. Honestly this was a chore to finish, the opposite of a quaffable APA. Starting to wonder if AleSmith is mailing it in outside of their IPA (still fantastic) and Speedway Stput (still one of the very best) or if they are just a two-trick pony.

On tap at AleSmith, pours a clear golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out dry piney hops, toasted biscuity malt and some hop resins. Flavour is bone dry, with lots of dry piney hops, toasted biscuity malt and a crisp crackery finish. About as good as a hoppy pale can be. Excellent.
On tap at Alesmith, Miramar. Golden with a white head. Fresh with hops, passion fruit, citrus and light malt. Quite crisp and easy to drink. A pleasant one.

on draft at PB Local - pours perfectly clear with pale amber color, and minimal head. on the nose, intense cattyness, some melon and lots of citrus from the west coast hops. medium light body, moderate carbonation and resiny texture. taste in dominated by a moderate but consistent bitterness combined with the tropical fruit, specifically the melon flavors. finishes dry with lengthy bitterness.

West Coast nose, flowery, tending to piney-resinous. A nutty maltiness as it warms up. Malty body with a bit more sweetness than most pale ales. Texture is slick and slightly oily. Bitter finish with no harshness. Pack a lot of flavor and body into a 6% beer. The body and slight sweetness make it an interesting variation on the West Coast pale ale style.

12 oz bottle. The pour is a darker orange with hardly any light passage. There is a creamy thick off white head and s pretty solid lace as into falls down. The aroma is surprisingly malty. There is a light fruitiness to it, but it¬ís mostly sweet malts. Must be an older bottle. The flavor is a little fruity and mostly malty. It¬ís got a hint of bitterness on the finish, and I kind of like that. It¬ís just very light and malty at the present moment. The mouth feel is pretty thick for a pale. It¬ís creamy and softly carbonated. The aftertaste is sweet malt mixed with a tropical fruit of some sort. This isn¬ít good.
Hazy orange color with a medium sized white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, toast, grass. Taste of citrus, grassy hops, some tropical fruit, grapefruit finish.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear orange with small off white head that lasts. The aroma is grass, mango, grapefruit. Medium body, citrus, grass, resin, light bitterness, very good.

Draft @ the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy peachy aroma. Fruity malty peachy citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy citrus finish.

I¬ím woefully uninformed about baseball (sorry, San Diego), but I think I know a great Pale Ale when I see one. This one¬ís pretty spectacular. Copper-gold pour with some haziness. Off-white head has good retention. Tropical and floral aroma. Juicy citrus and stone fruit flavors. Texture is a bit chewy with a dry, fruity finish. Definitely hop-forward but balanced. Nothing fancy here, just an exceptionally well-crafted Pale Ale.

Sampled on 12/12/16. This American Pale Ale pours a light to medium orange gold color from a 12oz bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head, with decent lacing and nice retention. Aroma is malty and tropical, kind of juicy. A medium bodied American Pale Ale. Malts are fruity, grainy and sweet. The hops are citrus and pine, and very tropical. Decent carbonation. Nice balance. Touch of orange and citrus. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp and a little dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

On tap at ale smith brewing. Pours out a cloudy golden topped with a white head. Nose is great tropical fruit some pine a nice cereal caramel malt. Taste is more of the nice tropical fruits citrus sweetness hops and a very well balanced malt.

Pours a hazy dark orange with a white lacing. The aroma is pungent citrus and creamsicle. This is aromatically tropical and akin to some east cost IPA¬ís, but with a dry bit not bone dry east coast body. Fantastic

Huge thanks to Tcon for this bottle. One that I have been waiting to try for a while now. It felt fitting to enjoy this beer on the final game of the baseball season. A great series it¬ís been. A series I¬ím sure one of the greatest hitters of all time would have truly appreciated. Very cool, keeper bottle. Old school Padres look. The same look celebrated at the mid summer classic this year. Pours an equally attractive color, a glowing golden orange. A forever lasting foam head as consistent as Tony Gwynn¬ís numbers at the plate. A juicy pineapple fruit aroma. Flavor is inviting grain, juicy tropical fruit, with peak refreshment. Semi sweet mango. Orange. A ton of fruit really. A beer celebrating baseball is a combination of my favorite things. Juicy linger forever. Overall an incredible pale here. I really thought ahead of time that I would score this a 3.94, but I can¬ít leave it short. The perfect beer to kick back with and take in some ball games. I need more of this!

Beautiful looker. Hazy orange Amber with a creamy white head. Aroma is caramel breads malt, tropical citrus - primo. Taste citrus with a nice run of piney hops with a closing bitterness. All riding over a nice dry malt backbone. Quite well-balanced. Really fantastic and highly drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid ass beer to represent one of the best pure hitters ever...that .394 year he struck out only 19 times in 419 at bats...unreal...great beer for a great guy...rip tony g....loved watching u play!

Minnesota Trip Beer #85. Keg at Muddy Pig, 5/9/16. Slightly hazy golden, thin foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of floral, citrus hops, pale malt. The taste is citrus, herbal hops, pale malt. Medium bodied, lingering bitterness, well balanced.

Bottle, with big thanks to Tom. I have a big soft spot in my heart for Alesmith. I came upon this whole beer world pretty late in life, and Alesmith entered the Seattle market right at the perfect time to grip me. I¬íd been lurking on ratebeer long enough to know how to use the search features, and had been drinking cool beers for awhile but was just starting to rate (in fact, a locally purchased Nut Brown was rating #18 for me). When I heard the chatter that Alesmith was coming to town, I did a little RB search and I¬íll be damned if they didn¬ít have the number 1 IPA, scotch ale, a top barley wine, and a top 10 beer overall, among others. So I went right out and bought a bottle of everything (well, everything except the grand cru, because that one was only rated high but not super high and why buy a beer lower than a 4.0 if I didn¬ít have to?). I brought them over to a cool beer-cognizant friend¬ís house to "help" him homebrew, and got to show off how much I knew about beer, telling everybody how these guys made some of the world¬ís best beers. And hell, I should know because I was a rater now, with 17 beers under my belt. In retrospect I¬ím sure I came off as a giant douche, but luckily I was with friends who could put up with my newfound enthusiasm. I¬íve (thankfully) mellowed since then, but I¬ím still a big fan of AleSmith, and even though I haven¬ít bought it in years I¬ím glad to know I can buy a 6er of their IPA at my local here in Cincinnati.

  Mostly clear amber pour, creamy head, great retention and lacing. Aroma brings caramel, citrus, orange-marmalade, biscuit. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Average carbonation, medium- body, oily texture. Overall: solid - would love to try it again closer to the source (especially bearing in mind after4ever¬ís review).
On tap in San Diego. Poured dark orange amber with white head. Aroma light dank hop. Light carb med bod. Taste balanced malt bitter drying dusty.

Tapped at the source. Clear golden copper color. Thick soapy head. Aroma of floral hops and damn good malt. Taste is nutty fruits, bitter hops, dry hoppy malty finish. Very refreshing. Medium carbonated. Good body. Excellent!
On draft at the brewerry. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of Mandarin orange and tangelos. Bitter roast finish.

Small head. Floral. White bread. Fine bitterness. Dry finish. Swell. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

6-pack. Pours a cloudy medium amber with a dense and sudsy off-white head that lasts.This is the first clue that this beer might not be quite as fresh, or even quite the same, as the batches that made its reputation. I ordered a couple 6-packs on the gushing enthusiasm of several friends who¬íd been to SD, and the corroboration of all the great rates here. Everybody who could possibly flip for an APA appears to have flipped for this beer. But all the high rates here call it a bright gold, and what¬ís in the glass now is decidedly cloudy and dark amber. Grist bill change? What¬ís up with this? Nose shows biscuity, toasty malts, some caramel, and a decent dose of pine and grapefruit. There¬ís a good range of rates for this beer now, but some of the higher ones call out an insane array of diverse hop notes. Blame where it¬ís due here--CraftShack shipped these 6-packs, and the box sat for over a week after I ordered it. Could the beers have been on the way from the distro and that¬ís why the box sat? Sure, possibly. But most likely it was CraftShack sitting on bottles that were getting no younger.Medium body with moderate carb. A tiny bit flabby for an APA, but this is the sort of thing that would go away with a bit more brightness from a proper hop bill, which might have faded somewhat now. Still, there¬ís a nice toasty caramel, with biscuity notes, and some good pine and grapefruit presence. This is a pleasant easy drinker, but hardly the explosive and finely-tuned flagship that so many have described. I definitely expect to bump up this rate if I ever get to SD.
Light citrus and some resin. Hazy golden pourbwith decent head and lacing. Clean finish. Ok, not much here though. Tap at Rattle n Hum.
(Tap) clear, bright deep yellow colour with a small white head; aroma of citrus, jam; assertive, balanced flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

Sample at the brewery taproom. The beer pours a slightly hazy orange-amber color with a medium creamy off-white head that diminishes gradually to a sparse outer ring. Short strings of lacing. Aroma of citrus, hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of piney hops, citrus and malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a hoppy aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

12oz bottle. Nice malt tropical fruit and hops flavor. Medium heavy body. Better version of Stone IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice pale ale Super tropical and hoppy. Pours orange with a tan head. Had at Jerry's 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy copper under a thin Rocky white head. The nose has this vibrant clementine and citrus zest bitterness at the nose with a bright leafy hop undertone. Crisp flavor with a mellow pale malt breadiness and very slight nuttiness, mixed citrus peel bitterness, balanced and crisp and a bit grapefruity and pale malt nutty.

Alaranjado de leve turbidez, espuma amarela de boa forma√ß√£o e persist√™ncia. Aroma de l√∫pulo floral, frutas amarelas, um pouco seco. Leve/m√©dio amargor e leve dul√ßor. Corpo leve e m√©dia carbonata√ß√£o. Final de m√©dia persist√™ncia, manga, mel√£o, bem tropical e refrescante.

APARIENCIA: de color √°mbar cobrizo con algunos destellos naranjas a contraluz, se observa media a alta actividad de carbonataci√≥n; corona de espuma color blanco de buena retenci√≥n, con burbujas compactas.

AROMA: notas c√≠tricas y frutales predominan como c√°scara de toronja, pi√±a, mango, algo ligeramente herbal y el dulzor de las maltas tambi√©n presente.

SABOR: al inicio un amargor medio bajo, seguido de notas c√≠tricas como c√°scara de toronja y naranja, algunas notas frutales como pi√±a, mango y dulzor de las maltas, todo bien balanceado y redondo; retrogusto un amargor medio bajo que queda pegado al paladar el cual es seco.

SENSACI√ìN: cuerpo medio ligero con buena sensaci√≥n oleosa en boca, carbonataci√≥n media.

RESUMEN: una buena american pale ale.

Quite biased being a Padre and Tony Gwynn fan. Grapefruit aroma with a hoppy bite. A sight honey sweetness at the end to round it out. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus, sweet, pine, really really good. Appearance is amber golden, off white head, mostly hazy. Taste is citrus, pine, tropical fruit, floral, good. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, citrus peel aftertaste. Overall, this is quite good.
Pale pour with nice hops in the aroma to the flavor. Well balanced. Not too sweet. Wet hop finish.

It pours golden in color. It has a slightly off white head. There is moderate lacing and moderate head retention. The aroma was strong enough to hit my nose from about three feet away. It has citrus, pine and biscuit aromas. The flavors highlight pine and citrus with a hint of peach, biscuit and a low level of caramel. The balance is strong towards the hops with a medium body. It has a smooth and moderately bitter finish. Overall, this beer has an excellent aroma it the presentation, not necessarily the complexity with a hop forward flavor and easy drinking finish.

Bottle in Las Vegas. Hazy orange pour, thin white head. Aroma of fruity hops, citrus, pine, resin and some tangerine. Flavor is quite bitter, fruity and very refreshing. Decent body, nice balance. Lovely brew.

[Bottle] Pours amber with a nice off-white head which fades quickly to a thin film. Aroma is great--lots of tropical fruit. Pineapple, papaya, and tangerine. Taste is also big on fruit--really juicy tangerine with just the right amount of malt backbone. Good mouthfeel, smooth, long finish. Slightly dry. Overall, a really, really solid beer.

Had it on draught in Gaslamp Quarters. Hands down amazing! Probably the best Pale Ale I have ever had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle from Appalachian Vintners in Asheville. 5/12/2016 bottle date is 2 months old. Excited this came in just as we were leaving. Orange pour, off white head with nice draping lace. Aroma has tangy pine, citrus and sweet malts. Taste is of sweet fruits, tangy pine, lemons, grapefruit zest and chewy resin, all on a sweet toffee bed. Medium bodied and softly carbonated, the flavor blend is quite good and there is a touch of alcohol. Finishes well blended between bitter and sweet, with each showing a strong presence. This does not break any new territory, but it is a very tasty pale that is very well done. 14.7

Poor is a nice orange color with a very long-lasting creamy white head. Great aroma this beer was bottled less than three weeks ago which is pretty cool considering I live in Pennsylvania.wow what a complex brew with lots of citrusy hops and nice mount backbone without being overpowering. A delicious Pale ale Highly recommend

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft at the source on 6/30/2016. Clear golden color with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, fruit, and light pine. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, mild caramel, floral notes, and pine. Refreshing.
Pours hazy gold with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, earthy and light toast. Taste is mild bitters. Light bodied with a dry finish. Nice.

Drank from a tulip, poured from a bottle, 
this ale was a medium burnt orange in the glass with some haze and presented a white and faint off-white creamy, three finger cover, it left very nice lacing on the glass, 

the aromas were fruity citrus hops that were perfumey and resembled fresh squeezed oranges and orange fruit, a little tangerine, grapefruit and pine notes, some toasted malt and a bit of bread in the background, less than medium fruit and malt sweetness, 

it had flavors of fruit citrus hops that had orange and hints of resin, toasted malt (less than medium), big orange and less grapefruit, some fruit and bread sweetness, 
there was a bitterness that was medium or bit less, the bitterness lingered a little on the tongue, toasted malt followed, 

this drink had average carbonation, the mouth feel was a light medium, it was creamy on the lips, 

the nose was very fruity, the hops were big for a pale ale, 
I liked the nose more than the flavor, a straightforward, good tasting pale ale.

On tap at brewpub. A slightly hazy orange hued golden with a short lived white head. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon, melon, tangerine. Flavor is loads of fruit (grapefruit, lemon, lime, tangerine, melon). Finish is light bitterness, with some hay and conifers. Bitterness lingers on for very long. Light to medium body, average carbonation, soft mouthfeel.
Pours a hazy copper with a foamy white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, and resin. Flavor is juicy citrus, pine, and resin, along with some caramel malts. Has a lively body. Quite good.

12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 5/17/2016. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 2 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a large cap that lasts. Dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, papaya, passion fruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, light caramel, biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with awesome balance and complexity of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, papaya, passion fruit, lemon zest, orange peel, pine, light caramel, biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, papaya, passion fruit, lemon/orange rind, pine, biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero astringent hop flavors after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky/resinous, and lightly creamy/bready balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6%. Overall this is an incredible American pale ale! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.
Nice tropical aromas. Love Tony Gwuinn. .394 a good pale ale but not a top of class for me. I think in MN we are spoiled on this style.

6%ABV. American Pale Ale.

Poured out gold Amber. 8¬∫SRM.

Nose has citrus and pine.

Mouthfeel is light soapy. Palate has pale malt with sweet, wheat flour, raw dough, water biscuits.

Finish is medium long bitter, herbaceous, spicy hyssop.

Goes on Favorites List !
This is pretty darn good. Not a ton of hops in either the aroma or body but the flavor is good. A bit piney but tasty.

12 oz. bottle from The Hop Yard, Raleigh (bottled May 11, 2016). Dark orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of fresh pine, tangerine, and sweet caramel malt. Taste is bitter but well-balanced with pine needles, fresh grass, soft grapefruit, and caramel malt. Moderate bitterness lingers on the palate. A nearly perfect example of this style.

While it does taste a bit more like an IPA than a PA, the damn beer is so good that the difference is piddling. Aroma is mostly grapefruit hop balanced with a little biscuit malt. Super yummy. Wish I could get more.
Pours a light, clear golden yellow, with minimal head. Strong aroma of citrus and tropical fruit. Flavor is rather muted. More biscuity and bready than citrus. Some hop bite in the bitter finish.

Pale golden orange pour with a soapy white head and lots of sticky lacing ..... Aroma of piney hops, citrusy grapefruit and orange, resiny and a bit rindy .... Taste is of piney and resinous/rindy citrusy hops, grapefruit and orange .... Nice bitter dry hop on the back end .... Finish is dry, bitter and has quite a bit of lingering pine/citrus and resin ... Slick and oily ... Perfect Cali pale ale
Pours bright orange with medium head. Strong hoppy floral aroma. Thick mouthfeel and the bitter taste of the hops coats your tongue. A nice strong ale. Bottle.

Taps clear golden with a nice eggshell head. Aroma presents hoppy,caress malt, and subtle pear notes. Flavor delivers resiny and slightly bitter hops, malt, and a pomme tone that mixes pear and apple. Mouthfeel features good body and firm, lasting, lively fizz. This one bats a homer!

On tap at Alesmith brewpub. Golden sud with little head. Way dank hoppy cannabis aroma. Immediately quite bitter but slowly fades and gets a bit fruity. I really like it. Great classic San Diego pale ale.
Strong piney hop aroma. Light and crisp. Very drinkable. Nice fresh color with a good head. Some citrus with a mild grainy malt base.

Draft in Mr Peabody¬ís, Encinitas on 8th May 2016. Menu called it Tony Gwynn .394 Pale Ale. Orange pour, full head which did not hang around long. Hop front with both citrus and piny notes in the nose with the citrusy hops taking over in the taste, semi-bitter and refreshing in the Californian sun.

Draft at Burger Bench in Escondido. I¬íve had this many times around San Diego, but just now rating. POURS a clear dark honey amber hue with one finger of frothy white foam that keeps a smooth layer on for a long time. AROMA has tropical fruit (mango and lychee, not overly ripe), stone fruit, wet pine forest, grapefruit, earthy hops, and light dank. FLAVOR full of nice tropical and stone fruit, some citrus and piney notes, smooth hops, with a solid honey / bready malt presence (lovingly balanced). Has a surprisingly creamy mouthfeel for a hoppy beer. Great beer, and nice to have such a solid one between a session and a full IPA (most APA¬ís come in on the weak side IMO, but this one is spot-on). (119, 1022)

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2017 On tap at Red Cow North Loop. Pours a clear gold with a white head that lasts throughout the beer and laces. Aroma has lots of citrus with a light earthiness and a bread backbone. Flavor also has lots of citrus with a decent amount of bitterness and a light grain backbone.

12 oz bottle from Pizza Port bottle shop. Light amber color. Lightly carbonated with small bubble foam. Nice initial light grapefruit hop aroma. Low bitterness. Medium to light body. Not bad, but not very flavorful either. Should be popular with BMC crowd.

Keg @ Red Cow. Light Amber with a small head. Nose is fairly fruity. Tropical fruit smoothie. Mango meat, citrus. A bit of white onion. Light biscuity body. Some hay and mellow grassy bitterness. Pretty dry on the finish. Smooth and easy drinking. Nice.
Copper pour with off white head. Aroma of floral and lightly citrus hops, some pale and caramel malts. Flavor is much like the nose suggest, but really well balanced. Just an awesome ale.
Draft. Clear light org gold. Frothy white head. Citrus and pine. Moderate bitterness. Mild dryness. Great balance. Light and easy drinking. Quality.

On tap at busters, pours a clear orange golden with small off white head. Aroma of bright sweet citrus orange and light caramel malt. Taste if sweet citrus and mildly sweet malt, with a dry bitter resinous pine all the way through. Clean and refreshing, not overly complex and we¬íll balanced, very nice!

on draft,poured into a snifter..orange with a medium white head..aroma of
pine,grapefruit,resin..tastes like it smells..medium bodied..solid.

Citrus pine aroma in a golden Amber pour. Laid back hop forward balance with tasty body and sustained bitter finish. An excellent example of the style and a brew that would be ideal for those not wanting a hop bomb.

Draft at First Draft in Chicago. First beer after the Whole 30 diet. Citrusy hop aroma, like twisting a grapefruit rind. Lots of citrus and soft peppercorn spice palate. Crisp and clean finish. Very nicely balanced.

Pint poured at south beach bar and grille in ocean beach. Pours hazy orange with a little bit of a white head. Smells sweet, like grapefruit. Taste is citrusy hops (cascade I think) with a soft bitter finish. Really good beer.

Draught @ Malt and Mold. Slightly cloudy rich golden with small foamy whitish head, faint malt aroma, low carbonation, lightly bitter malty taste, somewhat thick body, medium bitter finish. Very smooth and drinkable.

Draft at the ginger man NYC 
Clear yellow 
Aroma of pear, citrus.
Taste pear bitter fizzy, sweet

Draught as part of a flight at The Ginger Man, NYC.
Pours amber.
Quite British and malty with some citrus and passion fruit hops.

Tap at new bohemia uptown with commonmac and samadouche. Bumped pint. Dark gold copper with nice thick white head and good lacing. Clean hop nose. Taste is fresh, bright, sharp, with a nice light bitter finish. These guys do killer ipas. Definitely reached safely on this one.
Draft at Eastbound. Golden yellow por with a disapating head. Hoppy aromas and flavors. So close to an IPA

Tap at New Bohemia in Uptown. Bumped pint glass. Crisp, golden orange color with minimal head. Aroma is tropical fruit with some floral notes. Taste is super familiar and comforting like a pale ale you¬íve been drinking for a long time. Healthy hop bitterness without overwhelming the palette. Malty backbone. Great balance and finish. Much like Mr. Gwynn Alesmith is consistently great.

A dark golden color with a one finger head. Aroma is a nice combination of tropical fruits like mango, guava, and hops. Taste is fruity and hops. An amazing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Stein¬ís Beer Garden. Big tropical fruit aroma. Smooth and sweet with delicate malt, pleasant fruits.
When Tony helped design this beer, he wanted something that was hoppy up front but not bitter on the back end. That¬ís exactly what you get

The beer pours a honey amber color with a nice head. The aroma has flowers, hops and some lemon zest. The taste has some peach and apricots up front and the a bitterness comes through on the finish. Long finish and a very good balanced beer.
Very pretty copper with a white head. Pungent hop notes. Loads of citrus and some pine. Candied tropical notes. Lingerin butter finish. A mild sweet toasted malt background. Good pale.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle from slowrunner77 poured into a glass. Clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is herbal hops, medium body, lower carbonation, and pretty good small-bubble lacing. Taste is herbal hops and bitter.

Appearance was hazy gold with creamy diminishing white 1 finger head, rings of lacing. Aromas are floral tropical, citrus fruits with light hints of cracker sweet malts. Taste are pineapple, tangerine, orange, grapefruit blast upfront gives way to soft malt sweetness midway. The glorious lasting balanced slightly drying piney finish. Palate is light body with soft smooth CO2, then lasting clean beautiful crushable finish. Overall this is how you do a Pale, the best I¬íve had.
On tap @ Sheraton Quinn¬ís Alehouse. Light orange gold, hazy, lasting white head. White grapefruit aroma and character, reedy undertones, assertive bitterness.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Nice clean fruity hoppy base, light juicy citrus, mild moderate bitterness and low sweetness. Good stuff; very drinkable.

Rating #1536 - 20.03.2015 - Birthday beer tour - tap @ Alesmith - 4oz. Aroma is a spicy, grapefruity eruption right out of the can into the pour. Pours a straw yellow colour with a perfect sticky white foam, spotty lacing, decent retention. Medium carbonation, mild-medium alcohol warmth. Palate is a decent grapefruit citrus hit, with some sticky pine resin notes, and a comfortable ABV - I could probably crush this 39.4% of the time. Legend.
Tap at alesmith, san diego. Hazy deep golden color, white head. Aroma has hops, fruits, honey, ctirus. Balanced fruity taste, hops, citrus, honey.

Poured from a bottle. Orange-gold color. A little cloudy. Small white head. A good amount of lacing. Grapefruit and tropical fruit aroma. Citrus taste. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Gifted by a friend, thanks Mike! Hazy orange with nice two fingers of off-white head. Aromas of grapefruit and orange citrus, aged hops, floral notes, some malt. Tastes of slightly aged hops, floral notes, grapefruit and orange citrus. Medium body with a dry finish. No bottle date but may be a tad past prime.

Pours a golden amber color with a white head. Floral, citrus, hop and biscuit aroma. Grapefruit, mango, tangerine, pineapple, floral, and biscuit flavors. Medium body and carbonation. Very clean. Citrus finish.

Draught at the new tasting room in San Diego. Clear golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Fruity hop aroma, peach, passion fruit, pine apples, tangerines, red grapes, mango, caramel notes, some lychee. Hoppy pine flavor, citrus, grapes, pine apples, mango, peach, orange zest, lemon juice, mango, some tangerines. Outstanding beer, so fresh I could drink this forever.
Taster at brewery. Clear gold with white head and lacing. Floral, tropical fruit orange zest. Layers or hop flavor, balanced dry finish. Cheers to Tony G...
On tap at noodle house, OB. Huge hoppy aroma, comparable to an IPA, but less malt and bitterness. Refreshing, very drinkable. Terrific APA.

Bottle from Cost Plus. Pours a clear super light amber in color. 
lightly sweet hoppy nose. Grapefruit dominates. Pretty hoppy up front with a little bit of maltiness. Pretty much on the hoppy side of APAs. Tasty and easy drinking.

Sampled April 2015
A steady pour into my IPA glass produces a two-finger thick, pale tan colored head. The beer is a nice copper color that shows a brilliantly clear, almost metallic, bright copper hue when held up to the light. Even as I pour this beer it smells dense, juicy, and ripe with tons of hop fruit character. Screaming kumquat zest, amped up guava, tangelo zest, gooseberry concentrate, floral laden, tropical, slightly spicy fruit preserves just ooze from the aroma here.

Light bodied, with a perceived sweetness from the juicy hop character, but the beer finishes dry, and with a soft bitterness that is fairly clean. Peppery, with a slightly dank, herbal character up front that is backed by an ample, fruit character that contributes flavors of kumquat preserves, guava, spicy ripe mangoes, and a concentrated, floral peach character.

This is a really nice beer, if you like super hoppy, without bitterness, and with a supporting malt character then this should be right up your alley. I really like that this is only 6%. It is so well balanced, and not overly dry, which for me, really kills the juiciness of the ripe, fruity, hop flavors that beers like this should have.
Golden orange pour. Big white head. Great hoppy aroma of pine and grapefruit. Taste is pine but palate somewhat light. A little to bitter for a pale but really good ev n still.

Solid pale for sure. Goldish pour with decent white foam. Nose is hoppy with pine and citrus notes. Low on tropical fruit. Taste follows the nose with a decent hop punch in the face. Bready malt present as well.  Crushable in qtys.

Draft at the Observation Room. Brilliant clear copper color with a lacy whIte head. Nice citrus and pine hop aroma. The flavor is very balanced, with a subtle malty note then a pinch of hops, a west coast pale but not quite an IPA. Excellent mouthfeel, very crisp and drinkable. As usual, another very refined and perfectly to style alesmith brew.

Taster showing honey gold. 

The nose shows a lot of intense tropical mango. 

The palate is medium bodied, moderately carbonated. Moderately intense flavors of mango and a slight creaminess and barely any bitterness on the finish.
12 oz bottle, clear dark orange. Pine citrus nose. Taste hoppy bitter with good clean hoppy finish. Cool label BTW. Love the batman tony.

A golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, nice biscuit malt with loads of citrusy floral hops, grapefruit pulp, very nice. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with grassy floral hops, grapefruit pulp, nice and smooth, summer hop bomb. On tap at Cabot St location.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2015 Bottle to pint. Appearance: burnt orange color, nice fluffy white head. Aroma: nice tropical fruit hop aroma with a good amount of pale and sweet malt aroma coming through. Taste: get the malt/biscuit flavors first, then a hop bursted type hop presence that?s very mild and drinkable. Solid carbonation and clean finish.
Easy drinking pale ale with a strong hop aroma. Definitely a great session beer. Not overly bitter, finishes out nice and clean. Well done.

On tap at Mitch¬ís, San Diego. Sweet strawberry and apricot aroma with a sweet caramel background. Clear copper under a lasting, lacy white flannel blanket. Flavour is a good balance of light caramel malt and citrusy hops and medium bitterness. Accents of strawberry and apricot. Medium body, medium carbonation, almost crisp. Really solid pale ale.

Draught @ Alesmith Brewing Co Tasting Room, San Diego, CA. Pours a deep golden colour with a small foamy head. Aroma of fresh grassy hops, herbs and biscuit. Flavour of crisp grsssy bitterness, dank, mango sweetness and orange pith. Medium bodied. Crisp and dry finish. Nice and fresh.

Draught @ Alesmith, Miramar. Aroma has tropical fruits, pineapple juice and fruit candy. Flavour has gluey tones, grapefruit, pineapples and mild bush leaves in the leathery finish. Delicious and easy to drink - there is a slight gluey feeling at the end of the glass though.

Tap @ brewpub, San Diego.
Pours clear dark golden color with a small head. Nice hops on the nose, mandarin, orange and grapefruits, some caramel malts too. Grapefruit flavor with some caramel notes, lemon and pine. Crisp, refreshing.
3515

Draught @ AleSmith Tasting Room, San Diego, CA 

Pours orange with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy fruits, grassy hops, citrus and pine. Taste is smooth, sweetish and juicy fruity with some grassy hops, citrus and lemon. Finish is smooth, hoppy and sweetish with some fruits and grass. Pretty balanced.
Pours golden copper with little lacing. Aroma is straw with a floral accent. Taste is same as the aroma. Finish makes you want another sip!

Look, not bad, but just call it an IPA! Am I the only one annoyed by this recent beer trend? I wanted a smooth, easy pale--not to be hit over the head with hops. Yes, I like to take a break from the hops sometimes! Nicely constructed, but disagree with classification. 16 pour. @ Bulls BBQ

Dark golden orange in color.. Aroma of citrus, piney hops... Some tropical notes on the nose... Flavor is fairly dry, just enough burnt caramel malts to balance the dry citrus and piney hop palate... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How: Bottle (12 oz) at home. 

>>> An heavily drinkable Pale Ale with AleSmith malt signature and an amazing balance.

+  Drinkability is very high, thanks to a wondeful balance, good carbonation, clean mouthfeel and delicate malt backbone 
+  Like almost every AleSmith beer, the malt backbone is perfect for the beer. Subtle, but with a perfect honeyed and crackery touch and a mild spiciness that add some depth
+  There¬ís a moderate herbal/resinous bitter finish that add some punch to the beer, but it also dissipates quickly to leave a dry impression. Too often with these beers, the bitterness is sticky and hinders drinkability/enjoyability. This is not the case here 
‚àí  Aromatic features were not as bright as described by some others, but it might very well be because the bottles is a few weeks old if not more already

Flavors:  Citrus/tropical fruits, piney notes, earthy/mineral presence, mild caramel, honeyed malts
Bottle. Amber beer with a cream head. Grapefruit and pine aroma. Grapefruit and tropical fruit flavor with pine. Medium bodied. Grapefruit and tropical fruit lingers with light pine.

355ml bottle. Hazed golden pour, nice white head. Aroma is tropical nad citrusy with caramel bread notes, slight hint of herbs. Falvor is acidic, lemon notes, herbs, very acidic, tart, and dry. Nice one, super dry and puckering.
Got a six pack of this on a tip from a friend. Solid enough beer but it really just makes me want the ipa. Very drinkable on a lazy day though

Pours a clear orange with a medium white head. Aroma has light caramely malt and earthy hop notes. Flavor follows suit...piney, resinous and earthy...a touch of booziness though it¬ís not all that strong. Mouthfeel is light / medium and the finish is dry and earthy/piney/resinous.

Taster at the brewery. Golden-orange color with white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits, straight. Taste is the same, but with some greener stuff like shallots, grass, herbs. Huge complexity in that respect. Soft carbonation. Good mouthfeel, balanced light bitterness. Excellent and different APA.
Bottle extra from a trade .. 12 ounce .. Pours out Amber copper .. Great nose .. Fresh hay and citrus bitterness .. Solid all around .. But who¬ís the guy with the wiggle bat on the label?

Type: 12-oz. bottle 
Glass: Stone Ruination IPA pint glass 
From: Trader Joe¬ís in Mission Valley (San Diego), Calif. 
Price: $2.00 
Purchased: June 26, 2015
Consumed: June 27, 2015
Misc.: I¬íve had a taster of this, but this will be the first time I¬íve reviewed it.

Poured a paleish, orange, clear color with 2-to-3 fingers of off-white, frothy head. Just a few bubbles coming up from the bottom of the glass. Average, uneven lacing on the sides of the glass. Good retention on the top all the way down. (Sight - 4.25)

Very nice on the nose. Getting Simcoe, Mosaic, Citra, grapefruit zest, pine, tropical, mango, resin (on the back end), pineapple, floral and orange blossom. Reminding me slightly of a Duet and, to a lesser degree, Nelson. Smelling more like an IPA. Lovely. (Smell - 4.75)

Taste wasn¬ít nearly as good, but still decent. The hop flavor isn¬ít as potent either. Still getting Mosaic, Citra, floral, pine, grapefruit pulp, tropical, pineapple, mango, nectarine, orange blossom, peach and apricot. Could practically taste pulp. (Taste - 4.13)

Light body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Clean, crisp finish. Goes down well. (Feel - 4.00)

This was much better than the last time I tried it at the brewery. Very good. (Overall - 4.25)

4.27 95 A

12 oz. bottle from Best Damn Beer Shop. Pours a nearly clear golden amber with a small eggshell white head that laces the glass while settling into a ring and island of film. Aroma of caramel malts and hop pellets; herbs and spices and perfume, honey, fresh cut grass, marijuana, cereal, and a bit of spice. Flavor of caramel, tea, honey, grass, citrus, herbs, florals, and sweet cereal. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and an incredibly smooth mouthfeel. Smells amazing and drinks so easy. This beer is awesome. A fitting tribute to an all-time great hitter.

My Bottom Line:
From this smashing American Pale Ale rise flowers, citrus fruit and honey, a perfumy profile balanced out by fierce bubbling and resinous bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A healthy head of foam covers the translucent golden. Head retention is impressive too.
-The finish is relatively easygoing, which increases drinkability.
-That aroma is something else.
-The flavor profile is perhaps not as bright as the aroma. There is a quiet moment in the middle that 
-This one was better quite cool.

Bottle.

On draft at Alesmith. It pours a clear golden color with a small off white head. The aroma has a potent floral/citrus bouquet with hints of pine and tropical fruit. Classic and potent. The flavor is citrusy and a little floral. Little caramel. A pretty classic APA. Nice.
This is one dynamite little APA. I get fresh mandarin oranges and some grapefruit set neatly in a biscuit malt base. Very dry on the finish. Oh, and RIP Tony, I will miss you always.

Bottle from Sprout¬ís: Poured a dense golden liquid topped with a short lived frothy head. Fragrant aroma full of hops which reminds me of the fact that Ale Smith was behind this pale ale. Sadly, the flavor of the beer falls short and only has a minimal taste of bitterness hardly worth mentioning. What happened? This beer appeared as if it had a solid body and an aromatic smell but then comes up empty once you start drinking it. Extremely bland and the price definitely burned a hole in my pocket. The palate is smooth and gentle but overall I am not impressed.
Ale smith kills it on hop aroma. Citrus and light fruity hop nose. Poured orange little head lively carbonation. Taste of mild malts and American hops. Got last case at trader hoes.
Pours orange Amber, white head, huge tropical and citrus trends, mild onion. Generally balanced, has a light sweet underbody. Ligh body. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2015 Bottle. Orange amber, big head and lacing. Wow! The most tropical fruit juice flavor and aroma ever in a light bodied pale ale. Absolutely awesome. Pineapple, mango, passion fruit, etc. all coming in individual waves of flavor. Refreshing and delicious. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Clear dark gold/copper with a thick off white head. Aroma is dank with tropical fruit and citrus notes. Taste has tons of fruit. Pineapple, mango, passion fruit, lemon, lime and orange. Super juicy and fresh. Medium slick mouthfeel and relatively light carb. This is unbelievable.

12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of floral and lightly citrusy hops, some pale and caramel malts, and some light dough. Flavor the same. Average texture. A decent pale ale but not that great.
Bottle thanks GT2. Orange, citrus and herbal hop aromas. Nice session, flavors are citrus hop forward. Nice. Session?
12oz bottle. Pours dark golden with minimal head. Strong citrus and piney aroma. Taste follows with really nice pronounced grapefruit in the middle which I like. Nice finish....solid beer!
Bottle shared by Tom - thanks! Orange pour with a white head. Tropical, some sweet berry, hint of pine - just a hint. Not bitter on the tongue really at all. Really good.
12 ounce bottle. Thanks Eugene! Pours a bright clear gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and tropical. Taste is citrus, tropical fruit, pine, and malt. Excellent.
[2/19/15] Draught at Alesmith in San Diego. Pleasant hoppy aroma with tropical fruits, a bit overripe. Great flavor of fresh fruity hops. Medium-bodied.

14 mar 2015, tap at AleSmith. Yellow, clear, steady bubbles. Nose is sweet, candy, harsh pine hops. Ned body and moderately fizzy. Pine hips and strawberry ice cream. Hops are kind of skunky. I like the strawberry notes. Decent.
This is an awesome pale. Citrus hops with light tropical fruit. Cracker biscuit malts. Mild bitterness and light sweetness. Awesome.
draft, this is awesome. Great hop flavors, light and clean malt bill, fantastic hop flavors, light bitterness, long hop flavor finish,
On tap at the AleSmith tasting room. Poured a golden color with a white head. Citrus, fruity, and caramel.

Tap at brewery. Pours clear gold with thick, creamy white head. Aroma is spicy and floral hops, orange peel, pale and cereal malts, and faint grapefruit. Flavor is extremely smooth with exceptionally well balanced pale malts and citrus and floral hops with from faint spice and citrus peel in the finish. Medium body and carbonation.

On tap at alesmith. Golden color with full white head. Piney and citrusy hops on the nose. The taste is a very hop-forward pale ale. Juicy, like tropical fruits and with some bittersweet fruits. Carmelized malts make a breakthrough before being beaten down by kiwi, sweet grapefruit, and a m√©lange of citrus fruits. Although aggressively hop forward, the beer does not hit the palate as bitter. Actually, the beer finishes very smooth and creamy. One of the better pale ales made today. Should be made part of the regular line up.
Bottle from slowrunner. Pours clear golden with an attractive off-white head and a citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a ton of hop bitterness. Intenesly flavorful.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark gold with a creamy near white head. Icalll spicy NZ hop aroma. And melon. Med + body. Flavor is mildly roasted caramel backbone and a slightly burning mixed NZ hop bitterness. Wowser.
Sampler at the brewery during the Beer Geek Speedway release. Very nice - copper color. Nice hops. Nice malt backbone.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Aroma and flavor exploded with hops but without much bitterness. Just enough to temper the sweet. Mango and tangerine make for a soft juicy aroma and flavor. Hints of melon and pine. Can¬ít say I¬ím surprised, but damn Alesmith, you¬íve done it. again.
Gotta bump this even higher...enjoying the crap out of this.  Top 3-5 apa I¬íve ever had.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 11-2-16 Bottle pour at home, needed a beer to drink for game 7, and a baseball beer is the only way to go. Golden pour thin head, nice hoppy aroma, flavor is balanced smooth but with a little bit. Let¬ís go Cubs. 

2-6-15 Draft at brewery, RIP Towne Gwinn, this is a solid pale ale but for annoying one of the great baseball players make this a great beer. Props to AleSmith.
This beer is great. Hall of Fame worthy. Gold color, white head. Vibrant, juicy hops. Tropical fruit, light caramel malt. Drinkable and delicious as hell.

Pale ale. Too light for me these days, generally, as the hops aren¬ít as pronounced as I really enjoy and so many brewers go so light-bodied that the texture isn¬ít as pleasurable for me. This is a definite exception.

All of the fine things in a beer are presented to me when I crack the cap and breathe it in. Fresh pine, caramel malts in a soothing aroma and a sea-salted butter cookie underneath it all. This is one of the most aromatic pales I¬íve ever enjoyed. I could almost get away with breathing it in for hours for the warmth and buttery goodness of it; but my mouth is craving it, and so therefore I drink.
The brew is clear as glass, rich amber, covered in a heavy foam, the head displays its artistic lacing in a golden-white, thick and sticky.
The flavor is rich as well. Buttery caramel is absolutely up front, accented with a light pine that must have been soaked in grapefruit for hours, melting in my mouth and making me realize that I¬ím almost out of this delicious stuff!
The taste is mellow, the bitter there, and as completely hoppy as I need it to be, but so smooth that you could feed this brew to anyone and convert them to craft. The finish is only slightly dry, sticky and almost sultry. This liquid slips over my tongue; creamy and sexy, not too sweet, not too bitchy. Just right for a long, hot summer night of rhythmic music and a tiny bit of inhibition.
Draft at Alesmith. Nose is citrus (grapefruit), some light pine, and caramel. Crystal clear gold with a medium white head. Flavor is light bitterness, pine, and some caramel hints.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2015 Quand une brasserie comme Alesmith prend le temps de rendre hommage √† un grand comme Mr. Padres, tu te doutes que √ßa va √™tre digne de l¬íic√¥ne. √Ä ce point-l√†? Difficile d¬íavoir de telles attentes et pourtant, je suis renvers√©. L¬íenvol√©e de zestes d¬íagrumes est terrifiante, son jus de mangue et ananas transcendant et ses pointes de citronnelle et gazon frais emplissent mes sens. Sa buvabilit√© est unique, ind√©logeable, ma bi√®re pr√©f√©r√©e depuis mon arriv√©e.

Keg at Alesmith, a little diversion from the Speedway GP, 14/11/14.
Clear golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is citric peel, pine, floral hop, satsuma.
Taste comprises orange pith, juicy hop notes, pine, tangerine, light grapefruit, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent hoppy number.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 12oz bottle generously offered up in 6 pack format by hamilton23 so us AZ located Tony Gwynn fanatics can give this a try and pull up our favorite memories of Mr. San Diego while enjoying this. It pours up with a crystal clear copper body that has thin gold hues and supports nice looking near white head of foam. The aroma offers up a pleasing blend of mango, citrus, a bit resiny hops and then a thin ribbon of floral notes. The taste delivers a nice malt based pine hoppiness, some fruity mango, grapefruit and tangerine. Behind those notes lurks a wedge of floral hops just as the malts pick up a modest roastiness. Love it. This has plenty of bitter hops, a bit of a resiny hop edge and a spot on Pale malt base. Cheers to you Tony, we miss you.

On tap at the brewery. 
Aroma has a nice brass and cracker note with a lot of citrus, especially grapefruit and orange. Some lighter stone fruit and tropical fruit notes - mango, papaya and peach. 
Pours a clear golden color with a small, thick white head that exhibits good retention as it recedes to a thin that lingers. Really nice lacing. 
Flavor starts with a light sweetness and some cracker and biscuit notes. Moderate bitterness with a lot of grapefruit and lighter pine resin. Light notes of orange and tropical fruit. Some lighting cracker notes with grapefruit and pine resin. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice, hoppy pale ale with just enough malt character to carry all the hoops and bitterness. Really nice West Coast pale ale.
Light Amber color. Buscuit, Cabernet savoign and grapefruit. Great nose. Nice buscuity malt backbone with moderately aggressive hopping. Mildly sweet. Slightly bitter dry finish. Top notch.

Tap at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits and herbal hops with pineapple notes and light biscuit malt. Flavor is moderate hops, medium bitterness, light malt and fruity esters with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Pours a clear copper color with a bouquet floral aroma. A bitter flavor up front with a biscuit mouth feel. An easy aftertaste of malt that quickly disappears. A small amount of caramel in the taste, that makes the beer refreshing.

Draft at the brewery. Pours clear gold with a fizzy off white head. Tastes delicious, like grapefruit hops, strong smooth alcohol, caramel, and nutty roasted malt. Light/medium body and carbonation. Smells like caramel, orange, grapefruit, nutty, creamy, and boozy.

On Tap @ Srfside Tap Room. Clear, golden copper pour with a frothy white head. Pine, floral hops, citrus, and light biscuit in the aroma. Taste is citrus, pine, and even bitterness up front with a soft, bready malt backbone. Clean mouthfeel. One of the best APAs I¬íve had in a longtime.

Tap @ Alesmith... Poured golden amber with a white head. Nice lacing. Pungent, strong citrus hops on the nose and in the flavor. Thick mouthfeel. Gives the allusion of stronger ABV, but only at 6% this is quite the hefty APA. Bitter, green, resinous hops dominate with mild grainy character to keep it grounded.
On tap oro agrumata lieve nota fruttata amaro merio citrico agrumato secchezza media non molto corpo

On tap at their tasting room. Pours a clear golden with a thin white head. Aroma is citrus. Flavor follows. Some malt backbone but more like an east coast ipa. Really nice beer though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at the brewery with Linh. Pours a clear golden body with white lacing. Aroma is fruit - pineapple, mango and additional bitter citrus fruits. Mouthfeel is clean, nicely carbonated and sessionable with notes of citrus fruits, light pine and sweet sugary orange slices.

On tap at the brewery. It poured a light golden color with a white head. The aroma was of floral hops, grapefruit and some orange peel. The taste was of bread, biscuity malts and lots of floralness. Tasty.

Aroma: tropical fruits, peaches, flowers. Appearance: clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: subtle bitters continue, tropical fruits, mango and peaches again. Overall: nice APA, fantastic aroma. Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.
Pours a clear gold. Has a strong citrus hop aroma. Has a strong citrus hop taste with some pines. A dry and somewhat bitter aftertaste.

Tap at sublime del mar. Pours clear golden lots head and lacing. Nose is fruity and pine. Flavours of grapefruit, light cereal, lots of grapefruit. Taste medium bitter light sweet. Medium/light body with lively carbonation. Very drinkable.
great beer with a smooth hippy flavor and a great finish. Had at the brewery with audrey and look forward to the rest.

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2014 Cask tap at the brewery. Clear gold color with a small white head and nice lacing. Aroma is funky, dank hops... in a good way. The hops mellow in the flavor with light bitterness. Fine.
Beer Bloggers Conference - San Diego - Easy drinking pale ale. Nice piney flavor. Great beer in honor of Tony Gwynn

On tap @ The Dray. Pours pale golden yellow with thin lacy white head. Aroma is light crystal malt and dry floral hops. Taste is clean lightly oaky pale malt with dry notes of light citrus, berries, and floral spice on the hops. A little surprised by the restraint on the hops here from Alesmith, very mild with clean finish. Very drinkable, hope this makes it into their regular rotation. Plus I¬ím a sucker for a Tony Gywnn themed beer, so that helps.
On tap at the brewery. Pours an amber gold, lots of floral aromas, grapefruit. Lighter than their ipa, very enjoyable beer.
On draft. Golden orange amber pour, with a white head. Citrusy, some tropical fruit, kumquat, orange, light caramel sweetness, and bread. Moderately bitter. Enjoyable pale ale.

Tap at beer camp fest san diego
pours pale orange hue witb a small white head. Nose is mostly nice fresh grapefruit. Lots of pine as well. A hint of diacytl and just a pinch. Flavors exhibit big grapefruit and cracker malts. Solid pale ale!
Tap, golden pour, white head, nose is citrus, taste is citrus, a really easy drinking lovely floral beer.

8oz pour at Alesmith, keg, Conical half Pint, $4. Pours clear sparkling gold. Nice foam. Nose is sticky mango, mangosteen, jackfruit, vanilla, butterscotch. Taste is clean and session IPA like with kumquat and orange, orange Julius seltzer drink, Bubbly, juicy. Palate is mildly refreshing, nice orange juice forward.

Tap to grumbler. Pours hazy pale yellow/orange with a small white head. Nose is dank and citrusy with some floral notes. Flavor is very mild, sweet, citrus and pine with a mild bitter finish. Medium bodied. Very mild; a nice tribute to a great ballplayer and person.

Tap. Pours hazy butterscotch, small creamy of white head, nice lacing. Aroma is great, citrus, grapefruit, Passionfruit, dank, bit of spruce. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, juicy, citrus, pine. Medium body, full mouthfeel. Nice.

Pours a golden orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of flooral hops, citrus, pine, biscuit malts, bready malts, an some melon. Taste is about he same as the Roma with a nice floral, citrus and line hop profile with some melon in the background and a nice bready and biscuit malt background. Has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and a semi bitter, semi dry, medium finish. Overall, a very nice pale ale that is very drinkable and we¬íll balanced.

On tap @ AleSmith. Clear light golden pour with a white head. Nose is floral hops, grapefruit, and orange peel. Lots of bread and biscuit malt aroma as well. Nice clean bitterness, bready malt, and lots of floral qualities on the palate. Grapefruit and orange peel, some pine, and a hint of melon. Quite nice.
